channel.title: Startups on Yanir Seroussi | Data & AI for Impact
channel.description: Recent content in Startups on Yanir Seroussi | Data & AI for Impact
channel.copyright: Text and figures licensed under [CC BY-NC-ND 4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/) by [Yanir Seroussi](https://yanirseroussi.com/about/), except where noted otherwise

item.title: Mentorship and the art of actionable advice
item.description: Reflections on what it takes to package expertise and deliver timely, actionable advice outside the context of employee relationships.

item.title: Assessing a startup's data-to-AI health
item.description: Reviewing the areas that should be assessed to determine a startup’s opportunities and challenges on the data/AI/ML front.

item.title: My experience as a Data Tech Lead with Work on Climate
item.description: The story of how I joined Work on Climate as a volunteer and became its data tech lead, with lessons applied to consulting & fractional work.

item.title: Two types of startup data problems
item.description: Classifying startups as ML-centric or non-ML is a helpful exercise to uncover the data challenges they’re likely to face.

item.title: Avoiding AI complexity: First, write no code
item.description: Two stories of getting AI functionality to production, which demonstrate the risks inherent in custom development versus starting with a no-code approach.

item.title: Building your startup's minimum viable data stack
item.description: First post in a series on building a minimum viable data stack for startups, introducing key definitions, components, and considerations.

item.title: Substance over titles: Your first data hire may be a data scientist
item.description: Advice for hiring a startup’s first data person: match skills to business needs, consider contractors, and get help from data people.
